top_categories.workout_context: 100ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Devils Cardigan, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Devils Cardigan's Tasmanian mountains, Australian gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 120 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Devils Cardigan. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 120, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Devils Cardigan's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
12,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
12,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 120 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Devils Cardigan, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 12,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 120 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Devils Cardigan’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Devils Cardigan. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Devils Cardigan requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on tasmanian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: tasmanian mountains, australian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 120 miles of tasmanian mountain gravel in Tasmania, Australia.
